start-form.title: BioAfrica HHV8 Automated Subtyping Tool (Version 3.0)
start-form.note:
This tool uses phylogenetic methods to identify the subtype of query sequences.
Note for batch analysis: The HHV8 subtyping is based only in the K1 region of the genome, and accepts up to {1} sequences at a time.

tutorial-text.text:
Up to 1000 sequences can be submitted at once to the BioAfrica HHV8 subtyping tool.
The batch report (figure1) contains information on the sequence name, length, assigned subtype and a figure of the HHV8 genome. Accessing the report link will take the user to a report of each submitted sequence.

The sequence report (figure 2) is composed of three areas named: sequence assignment, analysis details and phylogenetic analyses.
The Sequence assignment contains information on:
the sequence submitted (name and length),
the classification assignment (subtype, subgroup and bootstrap support),
a graphical representation of the HHV8 genome showing the genomic region of the query sequence with the start and end positions related to the GK18 reference genome,
the motivation of the classification (this is based on the decision tree).
The Phylogenetic analysis section contains:
the phylogenetic tree in PDF and Nexus format,
the log file generated by PAUP (contains info on the model of evolution and its parameters),
the alignment used.

decisionTrees-form.title: BioAfrica HHV8 Automated Subtyping Classification Rules

decisionTrees-text.rule: Subtype assigned based on sequence located in the K1 clustering inside a HHV8 subtype and subgroup with bootstrap > 75%.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence located in the K1 clustering outside a HHV8 subtype and subgroup with bootstrap > 75%.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence located in the K1 do not clustering with HHV8 subtype with bootstrap > 75%.
HHV8 genomic region not supported for subtyping analysis identified with BLAST score > 200.

text.b: The subtyping process consists of three steps:

ul.li: The initiat steps involves the identification of the genomic region at the GK18 HHV8 reference sequence. This process uses BLAST software.
The second step involves the alignment of the query sequences with the complete K1 reference sequences for HHV8 subtypes A, A5, B, C, D and E. More information on this alignment is found in Table 1.
The final step involves construction of a phylogenetic tree using HKY distance method with gamma distribution in PAUP* software. The HHV8 subtypes and sub-groups are identified using JAVA software.
